required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Suture Closure AFtEr VEIN Access for Cardiac Procedures (SAFE-VEIN) Trial
clinical_study.official_title: Suture Closure AFtEr VEIN Access for Cardiac Procedures (SAFE-VEIN) Trial: A Randomized, Prospective Study of the Safety and Efficacy of Venous Closure Device Compared to Conventional Closure Strategies in Post Venous Access Procedures

brief_summary.textblock:
Primary objective: To compare the safety and efficacy of closure strategies post venous access procedures.
Hypothesis: We anticipate that the use of a venous closure device will decrease the time to hemostasis (TTH), time to ambulation (TTA) and time to discharge (TTD) compared to conventional methods of closure following venous access procedure.

detailed_description.textblock:
This study will be a prospective, randomized study of patients who are undergoing one or more of the following procedures at ASLMC:
Small-Bore Procedures ≤13F
1. Ablations, including any of the following: Ablation for AF atrial flutter, supraventricular tachycardia (SVT), and/or Atrioventricular nodal/junctional (AVN/AVJ) using the radiofrequency (RF) catheter.
2. Patent Foramen Ovale (PFO)/ASD closure
OR
Large-Bore Procedures >13 F
1. WATCHMAN® device placement
2. Atrial fibrillation/flutter/SVT ablation using cryoballoon or laser balloon
3. Leadless pacemaker
4. Pulmonary embolism thrombectomy (Inari FlowTriever system)
5. MitraClip transcatheter mitral valve repair
RANDOMIZATION:
Patients will be randomized into one of three venous closure groups or one of two venous closure groups based on their sheath bore size after a clean stick has been achieved with no complications:
Small-bore (5F-13F) venous access group (1:1:1)
- Perclose ProGlide SMC
- Figure 8 suture
- Manual compression
Large-bore (14F-25F) venous access group (1:1)
- Perclose ProGlide SMC
- Figure 8 suture

primary_outcome.description: The elapsed time between "device" removal and first observed and confirmed venous hemostasis

The elapsed time between removal of the final Perclose ProGlide SMC device (treatment arm) or removal of the final sheath (control arm), and the ability of subjects to stand and ambulate 20 feet without evidence of venous re-bleeding from the femoral access sites.

secondary_outcome.description: The elapsed time between removal of the final sheath, and the ability of subjects to be discharged. Total length of hospital stay.
Bleeding associated with ≥2 g/dl drop in hemoglobin level requiring transfusion, bleeding that occurs at a critical site, or bleeding contributing to death.
Any bleeding that does not meet the criteria for major bleeding
Access site hematoma, vascular thrombosis, vascular dissection, pseudoaneurysm, or AV fistula

arm_group.arm_group_label: Perclose ProGlide Suture-Mediated Closure System (SMC) - SMALL-BORE PROCEDURES
arm_group.description: Perclose ProGlide Suture-Mediated Closure System (SMC) will be used as closure strategy for venous access sites using sheath sizes less than or equal to 13F.
Figure 8 suture will be used as a closure technique for venous access sites using sheath sizes less than or equal to 13F.
Manual compression will be used as a closure technique for venous access sites using sheath sizes less than or equal to 13F.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Perclose ProGlide Suture-Mediated Closure System (SMC) - LARGE-BORE PROCEDURES
arm_group.description: Perclose ProGlide Suture-Mediated Closure System (SMC) will be used as closure strategy for venous access sites using sheath sizes greater than 13F.
Figure 8 suture will be used as a closure technique for venous access sites using sheath sizes greater than 13F.

intervention.intervention_name: Perclose ProGlide Suture-Mediated Closure System (SMC) - SMALL-BORE PROCEDURES
intervention.description: The Perclose ProGlide Suture-Mediated Closure System (SMC) will be used to close the vein access site(s) at the completion of the small-bore procedure in order to achieve hemostasis.
intervention.arm_group_label: Perclose ProGlide Suture-Mediated Closure System (SMC) - SMALL-BORE PROCEDURES

intervention.description: A figure 8 suture will be done as a closure strategy in order to achieve hemostasis in small-bore procedures.
Manual compression will be done in order to achieve hemostasis in small-bore procedures..

intervention.intervention_name: Perclose ProGlide Suture-Mediated Closure System (SMC) - LARGE-BORE PROCEDURES
intervention.description: The Perclose ProGlide Suture-Mediated Closure System (SMC) will be used to close the vein access site(s) at the completion of the large-bore procedure in order to achieve hemostasis.
intervention.arm_group_label: Perclose ProGlide Suture-Mediated Closure System (SMC) - LARGE-BORE PROCEDURES

intervention.description: A figure 8 suture will be done as a closure strategy in order to achieve hemostasis in large-bore procedures.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion criteria:
Small-bore (≤13F) Venous Access Procedures Inclusion Criteria:
All patients 18 years and older who are undergoing ablation using RF catheter (any of the following: AF ablation, atrial flutter ablation, SVT ablation, and/or AVN/AVJ ablation)or PFO/ASD closure at Aurora St. Luke's Medical Center from date of IRB approval through December 2021. All arterial line access should be radial.
Large-bore (>13F) Venous Access Procedures Inclusion Criteria:
All patients 18 years and older who are undergoing any of the following: WATCHMAN® device placement, atrial fibrillation ablation using cryoballoon or laser balloon, leadless pacemaker, Pulmonary embolism thrombectomy (Inari FlowTriever system), MitraClip transcatheter mitral valve repair at Aurora St. Luke's Medical Center from date of IRB approval through December 2021. All arterial line access should be radial.
Exclusion criteria:
Small-bore (≤13F) Venous Access Procedures Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients in whom introducer sheaths >13F were used in the vein during the catheterization procedure.
- Patients with small femoral arteries or veins (< 5 mm in diameter).
- Patients with access sites in vascular grafts.
- Patients with intra-procedural bleeding around access site. Patients who cannot receive radial arterial line access.
- Patients who have complications during the procedure not related to the Perclose ProGlide SMC closure device
- The physician determines that they must use an alternate method as the primary venous closure method other than that which the patient was randomized to
- Active systemic or cutaneous infection, or inflammation in vicinity of the groin
- Pre-existing immunodeficiency disorder or chronic use of high dose systemic steroids
- Known history of bleeding diathesis, coagulopathy, hypercoagulability or platelet count < 100,000 cells/mm3
- Severe co-existing morbidities with life expectancy less than 12 months
- Femoral arteriotomy or femoral venotomy in < 10 days, or with any known vascular complications or residual hematoma, or with use of an intravascular closure device w/in previous 30 days
- Planned femoral venous or arterial access within next 30 days
- Unable to routinely walk at least 20 ft. without assistance
- LMWH within 8 hours before or after procedure
- Pregnant and/or lactating women
- Extreme morbid obesity (BMI > 40 kg/m2) or underweight (BMI < 20 kg/m2)
Large-bore (>13F) Venous Access Procedures Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients in whom introducer sheaths >25F were used in the vein during the catheterization procedure.
- Patients with small femoral arteries or veins (< 5 mm in diameter).
- Patients with access sites in vascular grafts.
- Patients with intra-procedural bleeding around access site. Patients who cannot receive radial arterial line access.
- Patients who have complications during the procedure not related to the Perclose ProGlide SMC closure device
- The physician determines that they must use an alternate method as the primary venous closure method other than that which the patient was randomized to
- Active systemic or cutaneous infection, or inflammation in vicinity of the groin
- Pre-existing immunodeficiency disorder or chronic use of high dose systemic steroids
- Known history of bleeding diathesis, coagulopathy, hypercoagulability or platelet count < 100,000 cells/mm3
- Severe co-existing morbidities with life expectancy less than 12 months
- Femoral arteriotomy or femoral venotomy in < 10 days, or with any known vascular complications or residual hematoma, or with use of an intravascular closure device w/in previous 30 days
- Planned femoral venous or arterial access within next 30 days
- Unable to routinely walk at least 20 ft. without assistance
- LMWH within 8 hours before or after procedure
- Pregnant and/or lactating women
- Extreme morbid obesity (BMI > 40 kg/m2) or underweight (BMI < 20 kg/m2)
